word: If we find a poor widow struggling to support her family we show our sympathy in a tangible way, and help her to help herself. We seek to awaken the missionary spirit in our churches. We appeal to the members to show their religion by their works of sympathy and do all they can.--Letter 232, 1899, p. 6. (To Dr. J. H. Kellogg, November 10, 1899.)
